message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including poor feeding, oral thrush, and skin lesions, suggest a yeast infection, most likely caused by Candida albicans. Defective beta-2 integrin is associated with leukocyte adhesion deficiency, which increases susceptibility to infections by Candida and other opportunistic pathogens, and can present with symptoms similar to those of the patient. Defective tyrosine kinase is associated with severe combined immunodeficiency, defective microtubules are associated with Chediak-Higashi syndrome, and defective actin cytoskeleton is associated with Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, all of which can also lead to increased susceptibility to infections, but their symptoms and laboratory results are different from those of the patient.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and laboratory findings suggest disseminated candidiasis, a fungal infection. Defective beta-2 integrin is associated with leukocyte adhesion deficiency, which predisposes individuals to severe bacterial and fungal infections. Defective tyrosine kinase is associated with X-linked agammaglobulinemia, which also leads to increased susceptibility to bacterial and fungal infections. Defective microtubules and defective actin cytoskeleton are not associated with immune deficiencies.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of poor feeding and lethargy, as well as the elevated leukocyte count, suggest a systemic infection. The presence of white oral patches and skin lesions in the groin suggest a fungal infection, specifically Candidiasis. Defective beta-2 integrin is associated with impaired leukocyte adhesion, leading to increased susceptibility to infection, including fungal infections such as Candidiasis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, as well as the growth of pseudohyphae, suggest Candida infection. Among the options, only defects in beta-2 integrin are associated with increased susceptibility to Candida infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including poor feeding, lethargy, oral thrush, and skin lesions in the groin suggest a possible fungal infection. The presence of pseudohyphae in blood cultures is a clue for Candida species. Among the options, only defective beta-2 integrin is associated with increased susceptibility to Candida infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and laboratory results point towards a fungal infection, most likely caused by Candida. Defective beta-2 integrin is associated with leukocyte adhesion deficiency, which increases susceptibility to bacterial and fungal infections. Defective tyrosine kinase is associated with severe combined immunodeficiency, which would have presented earlier in infancy. Defective microtubules and actin cytoskeleton are not directly related to immune function.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The oral patches and skin lesions suggest a fungal infection, and the blood culture confirms it. Among the options, only defective beta-2 integrin is associated with an increased susceptibility to fungal infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The clinical presentation and laboratory results suggest a fungal infection, specifically Candida. Defective beta-2 integrin is a risk factor for fungal infections, as it impairs leukocyte function and ability to clear infections. Defective tyrosine kinase is seen in some types of leukemia and lymphoma. Defective microtubules and actin cytoskeleton are associated with genetic disorders.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including poor feeding, lethargy, and white oral patches, suggest a possible candida infection. The growth of yeast cells that form pseudohyphae further confirms this. Among the options, only a defective beta-2 integrin is associated with recurrent candida infections, as it impairs leukocyte migration and phagocytosis, leading to reduced immunity against candida infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a fungal infection, especially with the presence of white oral patches and skin lesions in the groin, and the blood culture results confirm this. Defective beta-2 integrin is associated with leukocyte adhesion deficiency syndrome (LAD), which predisposes individuals to severe and recurrent bacterial and fungal infections, and may explain the patient’s susceptibility to this fungal infection. Defective tyrosine kinase, microtubules, and actin cytoskeleton are not associated with LAD.
